intro: Ziziphus robertsoniana, commonly known as Robertson's ziziphus, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to parts of eastern Africa. It belongs to the Rhamnaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are often elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by edible, fleshy fruits that are typically red or orange when mature. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
